clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Evaluation of Needle Exsufflation for Pneumothorax
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Pneumothorax Duration Before Treatment on the Success of Needle Exsufflation

brief_summary.textblock: Monocentric observational study of needle exsufflation for pneumothorax in the ICU.

detailed_description.textblock: The main objective of this prospective observational non interventional study is to investigate a possible relationship between prior duration of pneumothorax (defined as the duration from first occurence of chest pain reported by patient to exsufflation) and the success of exsufflation procedure (defined by the absence of a chest tube insertion in the following 24h).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with early success of needle exsufflation
primary_outcome.description: success of needle exsufflation is defined as the absence of chest tube insertion requirement within 24hrs following needle exsufflation

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with early success of needle exsufflation with duration of symptoms prior to exsufflation greater than 48 hrs
primary_outcome.description: success of needle exsufflation is defined as the absence of chest tube insertion requirement within 24hrs following needle exsufflation; duration of symptoms prior to exsufflation is the time (in hrs) elapsed between first chest pain reported by the patient and needle exsufflation

secondary_outcome.description: participants will be followed for the duration of ICU stay, from ICU admission to ICU discharge, an expected average of 8 days
participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, from hospital admission to hospital discharge, an expected average of 15 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients requiring early surgical pleurodesis because of persistent pneumothorax
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be monitored for eventual need for surgical pleurodesis during their ICU stay because of persistent or worsening pneumothorax

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with late exsufflation failure
secondary_outcome.description: late exsufflation failure is defined as patients requiring chest tube insertion at least 24 hrs after needle exsufflation because of persistent or worsening of pneumothorax despite initial early success

other_outcome.measure: Number of patients with pneumothorax recurrence
other_outcome.description: Patients will be followed for an expected average of 30 days to identify those with recurrent pneumothorax

other_outcome.measure: Maximal patient self-reported pain during procedure
other_outcome.description: patients are asked to assess the maximal pain felt during needle exsufflation or chest tube insertion with the use of a numeric scale from 0 [no pain] to 10 [worst possible pain]

other_outcome.measure: Number of patients with treatment-related adverse event
other_outcome.description: Patients will be followed for 8 days to identify those with either hemothorax (defined as hematic pleural effusion requiring thoracic drainage); or a vacuo pulmonary edema (defined as occurrence of localised alveolar interstitial opacities on post-procedure chest X-ray); or site of chest tube insertion infection (presence of purulent secretions issuing from chest tube insertion site)

study_pop.textblock: adult patients admitted to the ICU with a pneumothorax

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult ICU patients requiring needle exsufflation for spontaneous pneumothorax
Exclusion Criteria:
- refuse to participate
- contraindications to needle exsufflation (acute respiratory failure requiring immediate chest tube insertion)
